page.title: 16TWYN SQUARE
page.content: {Twyn}means 'hillock' which indicates that a mound or tumulus may once have existed on the site.{Twyn}Square is very close to the Castle and was used for fairs. It is known that the town market was held in this square as long ago as 1459,and this continued to be until 1598 when the market site was transferred to New Market Street.The following extract survives from the 1816 fair-charter. "It is strictly given you in charge that no person shall go{armed}or carry {any}offensive weapon during the time of the fair,and that no leathery to be worn."
